title: 51. The Great Fire of Rome
description: An evaluation of the causes, impact, and aftermath of the Great Fire of 64 CE, weighing ancient accusations against Nero with evidence of relief and reconstruction.

questions.question: In which year did the Great Fire of Rome occur?
Why was Rome particularly vulnerable to fire?
Where did the Great Fire begin?
options: In shops near the Circus Maximus

questions.question: How long did the fire burn for?
How many of Rome’s fourteen regions were undamaged?
Which areas largely escaped destruction?
options: The Forum, Capitol, and part of the Palatine

questions.question: What immediate relief measures did Nero take?
options: Opened his gardens and public buildings to the homeless

questions.question: How did Nero address food shortages after the fire?
options: Brought supplies from Ostia and reduced corn prices

questions.question: Which source directly blames Nero for starting the fire?
What motive does Suetonius attribute to Nero?
options: Desire to rebuild Rome more grandly

questions.question: According to Suetonius, what did Nero do during the fire?
options: Sang of the fall of Troy

questions.question: How does Tacitus differ from Suetonius in his account?
options: He fully agrees Nero was guilty
He presents both accidental and deliberate explanations

questions.question: Where was Nero when the fire broke out, according to Tacitus?
What rumour intensified suspicion against Nero?
options: A second outbreak on Tigellinus’ estates

questions.question: What major building did Nero construct after the fire?
How does Pliny the Elder describe the Domus Aurea?
What building regulations were introduced after the fire?
How did Romans generally react to the rebuilding programme?
Which group was blamed as a scapegoat for the fire?
Which source describes the persecution of Christians in detail?
How does Suetonius describe Christians?
What punishments were inflicted on Christians?
options: Crucifixion, burning, and execution by dogs

questions.question: What was the public reaction to the persecution?
What religious action did Nero take after the fire?
What overall conclusion does the PPT encourage?
options: The evidence is mixed and uncertain
